page.title: 11STEWARTBY: CHILDRENS VIEWS
page.content: There is very little for the children to do as no clubs or activities are organised. There is a swimming pool which is not always open. The houses are ideal for a family of four or five. They used to belong to the brick works but now they have been put up for sale. This is a very good opportunity for first time buyers and families with young children because the houses are quite cheap. There are also two schools in the area and mother and toddler groups. The retired people in the village are well looked after. They have comfortable bungalows and a large hall where games are played and ladies can have their hair done. There are often trips to well known places and there is a small but friendly Church. There is little chance of the old people feeling lonely.
